alert.note: Alert for Cimarron (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 3:43PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Cimarron County through 415 PM CDT... At 342 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles northwest of Keyes, or 14 miles northeast of Boise City, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Cimarron County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for the Panhandle of Oklahoma.
